discription: Parents or individuals saving for education expenses may prefer a lump sum to cover tuition fees or other educational costs.
Entrepreneurs looking to start or expand a business might require a lump sum for capital investment, equipment purchase, or operational expenses.
Those involved in estate planning may prefer a lump sum to facilitate the distribution of assets among heirs or beneficiaries.
Individuals planning for retirement may choose a lump sum to create a nest egg that can be managed and invested to generate a regular income stream during their retirement years.
